with white even touching the inside edges of the brazier there and then
we're going to use yellow I'm going to brush it on but let the white show
through so let the white bits show through and where you've been and then
with red I'm just gonna dab on the red so don't brush it on dab it on then mix
in some of the yellow and begin to go around the edges with that sort of
orange color allowing the yellow and the white to still show through and then I'm
going to hit the edges of the room with red okay there you go so that's going to
give us that heat look and I'm just going to clean my brush with this paint
brush cleaning mixture that I've concocted I actually stole it the idea
from something else but we'll talk about that in a lab video it's really good for
revitalizing cheap crap brushes so then we're going to mix up some gray with
black and whites and pull towards the top from the bottom so from the bottom
pull towards the top and then pull towards the top with some black to give
it that sort of look to the top of the brazier and that's really pretty
